title: Remove dodge punishments if
body:
If the error box for failing to ban / lock in a champ comes up can the dodge timer atleast be turned down from 30 to 6.

I dodged a game where someone refused to play their role today and my game froze when I tried to lock in with 4 seconds left, afterwards the error box came up and I dodged, getting a 30 minute timer and losing 10LP

I don't see how it would be abused but more likely Riot just cant implement it. Anyway it'd be useful for a lot of people I know who have this same problem

replies.body: You shouldn't have gotten a 30 min LPQ just for leaving that one match. Rather, the system must have noticed a history of leaving which eventually led to this 30 min timer. Regardless, the best route to take for people refusing to play the role they were placed in would be to report them in post game if they were trolling the match. We can't reliably let people off the hook for dodging just because they didn't want to play with certain people, we also don't have any way of knowing exactly why they left.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Gxa3BzIh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-07T01:45:58.818+0000)

> You shouldn't have gotten a 30 min LPQ just for leaving that one match. Rather, the system must have noticed a history of leaving which eventually led to this 30 min timer. Regardless, the best route to take for people refusing to play the role they were placed in would be to report them in post game if they were trolling the match. We can't reliably let people off the hook for dodging just because they didn't want to play with certain people, we also don't have any way of knowing exactly why they left.

You would if you implemented a report log for champ select and post game lobby.

I'm sorry, but this is a non solution.

You're asking 4 people per match to sit through at minimum 20 minutes of dealing with an obviously toxic player (because the fifth is simply not going to agree to a unanimous surrender at 15, naturally) on top of accepting a loss due to being trolled, just to be able to reach the end-game screen to be able to report the problem causers.

That's completely unreasonable and unacceptable.

If your client and engine currently don't allow you the means to provide a way to report people sooner, you need to develop such a way and add it to the game.

If you don't have a reliable way of knowing why people leave a lobby, then create at least one way for them to leave which does tell you why they left.

How about a "Vote of No Confidence" button? Where if even two different people in a lobby feel like _"This match is going to be a dumpster fire, I need to get out"_, they can hit it, and the match is canceled. Give it charges similar to champion rerolls in ARAM so people only use it when they really need to. Put a short delay on getting back into matchmaking, so it doesn't mess anything up in that regard. And have it auto-log the chat from the lobby for review when activated, to fascilitate stopping the toxicity.

Or come up with something else if you prefer. But at the very least, we need to know this is on your radar, and that you're actually going to attempt to do something about it, because as I will reiterate - the way things work right now is completely unacceptable.
